settings.text: The start of each bike, to the finish of each race

settings.content: Learn about the evolution of the UK's fastest growing bike brand

settings.text: Handsling Bikes manufacturers high-quality carbon bicycle frames and wheels. The frames are painted in limited edition colours, then built up into full bikes with customised specifications for every rider.

settings.content: Swipe to discover more about the evolution of Handsling's History.

settings.title: Origins of the Handsling brand
settings.content:
Handsling started off as a media publishing company that promoted its business by sponsoring the London-based Handsling Racing Team.

Swipe to discover more (mobile) ›››

settings.title: Race proven bikes
settings.content: When the Handsling Racing Team's bike sponsorship expired, the team owner looked to manufacture his own frames and approached one of the world's leading carbon manufacturing facilities, as used by a top pro team. The resultant frames were an immediate hit, winning multiple races.

settings.title: The bike brand is born
settings.content: When other riders started to request replica bikes, it led to the formation of Handsling Bikes as a limited company. The model line up included the RR1 and A1R0 road frames, TR1 track frame, and CXC cyclocross frame. Handsling sponsored a young Fred Wright with the RR1, and over the next few years championship titles followed with Oscar Nilsson-Julien, Graham Crow, Allan Davis, Catherine Coley, and Charlotte Cole-Hossain. Thomas Burnett claimed the South-East regional cyclocross championships.

settings.title: The RR1
settings.content: The RR1 was Handsling’s most successful road model, winning many races and even being ridden in Belgian Classics.

settings.title: The A1R0 and A1R2
settings.content: The stiff, aero road frames, dubbed the A1R0 and A1R2, notched up multiple criterium victories.

settings.title: TR1, TR2 and TR3
settings.content: On the track the TR1, TR2 and TR3 frames achieved win after win.

settings.title: Relocation and expansion
settings.content:
In 2018, Handsling relocated from London to Hampshire, allowing further expansion, with a larger workshop and more staff.

New investment meant that Handsling could design its own new, unique frames and purchase the moulds used to manufacture those frames.

settings.title: New frame launches
settings.content:
Handsling released three in-house designed frames: the A1R0evo for road, the TR3evo on the track, and the CEXevo for cyclocross and gravel.

The TR3evo immediately displayed its race credentials at the UCI World Track Championships in the hands of Amber Joseph of Barbados.

settings.title: Covid 19 pandemic
settings.content:
Handsling was hard hit during the pandemic, with frames stuck overseas in the factory, followed by a shortage of groupsets.

However, Handsling emerged stronger from the pandemic, moving into new, even larger premises and ramping up production.

settings.title: Business and race success
settings.content:
Strong Handsling brand recognition led to increased worldwide sales with bikes shipped throughout the UK and Europe, plus Scandanavia, Japan, South Africa, Australia, the Carribean, USA and Canada, Israel and the Middle East.

2021 was an excellent year for TR3evo riders on the track. At the European Track Championships, GB's Josh Giddings won gold medals in the team pursuit and Madison, and Amber Joseph raced at the 2021 Track Cycling World Championships in Roubaix.

settings.title: Pro team sponsorship
settings.content:
Handsling sponsored its first pro team, Chaney Windows & Doors Cycling in the USA and the team racked up 16 medals at the US National Track Championships.

Later that year, Handsling became a headline sponsor, as the bike supplier to the DAS-Handsling Women's UCI Continental Team. The top ranked women's team in the UK provides a platform for young talent to develop at elite level.

settings.title: On track with new frames
settings.content:
Handsling is launching a host of new frames. A dedicated time trial frame, the TSTRevo will be raced by the DAS-Handsling pro team, and after being withdrawn during the Covid pandemic, Handsling is relaunching the TR2evo in sprint and pursuit guise.

Also in the pipeline is a new aero gravel frame and an all-road frame.

settings.title: Professional Spray Booth
settings.content: This professional facility allows us to bring frame painting and finishing in house. Carbon frames are now imported from our factory and fully finished in the UK, before being built into complete bikes.

settings.title: British National Champs Win
settings.content: Kate Richardson sprinted to victory on the Handsling A1R0evo, clinching the British National Championship in a three-way photo finish, just a month after her Tour de Fémin win. This triumph follows the Handsling A1R0evoS’s 9/10 Cycling Weekly review.

settings.title: Where does the name 'Handsling' come from?
settings.content: The Handsling is a feature of some of track cycling's most spectacular events - the Madison and the Six Day races - where riders help their teammates back into the race by grabbing their hand and literally slinging them into the fray. This handsling provides a 'helping hand up to speed' for your team-mate in these events. With Handsling, the aim is to offer customers a helping hand to the best riding experience and to support them on their cycling journey.
Swipe to discover more about the evolution of Handsling frames and upcoming launches.

settings.title: RR1
settings.content: The RR1 was Handsling’s most successful road model, winning many races and even being ridden in Belgian Classics.

settings.title: A1R0 + A1R2
settings.content: The stiff, aero road frames, dubbed the A1R0 and A1R2, notched up multiple criterium victories.

settings.title: TR1, TR2 and TR3
settings.content: On the track the TR1, TR2 and TR3 frames achieved win after win.

settings.title: CEXevo
settings.content: The CEXevo was the first unique Handsling frame, an adaptation of an existing model to produce a versatile cyclocross racer and adventure bike.

settings.title: A1R0evo
settings.content: This was followed by an in-house design developed by Handsling from scratch: the A1R0evo. The aerodynamic disc-brake frame combined the best features of the successful RR1 and A1R0 road models.

settings.title: TR2evo
settings.content: Handsling then bought into a share of the TR2evo super stiff track frame.

settings.title: TR3evo
settings.content:
In 2019, the new TR3evo track frame was launched and was ridden at the UCI World Track Championships by Amber Joseph.

Amber rode a TR3evo again at the 2021 Track Cycling World Championships in Roubaix.

settings.title: New Handsling Models
settings.content: Handsling continues to develop new in-house designed models. A time trial frame will soon be launched, quickly followed by a track frame with pursuit and sprint versions.
Learn how Handsling designs and manufacturers its frames
Handsling's UCI-approved frames are ridden at the highest level of elite cycling. Handsling is the official bike supplier to the CWD Cycling and DAS-Handsling teams
